Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized, Susceptibility To, 14 present clinical features that include seizures, mental retardation, autism, and language impairment.

Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized, Susceptibility To, 14 is a rare disease. It is estimated to affect less than 1 in 200,000 individuals in the European population.

Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized, Susceptibility To, 14 is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

Epilepsy, Idiopathic Generalized, Susceptibility To, 14 is inherited in an autosomal recessive manner.
